articles.author: Mohi Narayan
articles.description: China's demand for petrol is likely to peak as early as next year as electric vehicle sales soar, several analysts say, bringing forward an energy transition milestone for the world's biggest polluter and a headache for global refiners.
articles.title: Analysis: China's gasoline demand peak nears as EV boom hastens transition

articles.author: Carolina Mandl, Herbert Lash
articles.description: U.S. stocks ended lower on Thursday after news that the Bank of Japan will allow long-term interest rates to rise sent U.S. yields higher, snapping the longest winning streak for the Dow since 1987.
articles.title: Wall Street closes down, Dow snaps longest winning streak since 1987

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: For foreign automakers in China, it is time to double down on a turnaround or cut losses after ceding their leadership of the world's biggest auto market to local, upstart brands.
articles.title: Analysis: Global automakers scramble to reset China strategies as sales slow

articles.author: Aditya Kalra
articles.description: Walt Disney's (DIS.N) India streaming service plans to start enforcing a policy of allowing its premium users to login from only four devices, an effort aimed at limiting password sharing in a key market, two sources with direct knowledge said.
articles.title: Disney's Hotstar India streaming service plans to limit account sharing -sources

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Australian state of Victoria will ban natural gas connections to new homes from next year as part of a plan to cut emissions and lower energy bills, the state climate action minister said on Friday.
articles.title: Australian state bans gas to new homes from 2024 in push to cut emissions

articles.author: Ellen Zhang, Marius Zaharia
articles.description: Cola Yao earns 40% less than last year promoting credit cards for a Chinese state-owned bank, so she buys fewer clothes, less make-up and has cancelled her child's summer swimming classes.
articles.title: Analysis: White-collar wage cuts in China fuel deflation risks, hurt consumption

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: A high-profile lawsuit by a California woman who claimed that Subway's tuna products contain ingredients other than tuna has been dismissed.
articles.title: Subway tuna lawsuit has been dismissed

articles.author: Leika Kihara
articles.description: The Bank of Japan is set to keep ultra-low interest rates on Friday but may make minor tweaks to extend the lifespan of its yield control policy, which is facing scrutiny amid prospects of sustained inflation.
articles.title: BOJ seen keeping ultra-low rates, may relax yield control

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. prosecutors broadened their criminal case against Donald Trump on Thursday as they charged a second of his employees with helping the former president evade officials who were trying to recover sensitive national security documents he took from the White House.
articles.title: Second Trump employee charged in US classified documents case

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Wednesday that Ukraine had intensified its frontline attacks over the last few days while a Ukrainian official said Kyiv was making slow but steady progress in liberating its territory.
articles.title: Putin says Ukrainian attacks intensify as Kyiv touts steady gains
